en.sc1: Consider the nodes 1 through 4 as transactions needed to be logged within a block.
en.sc2: These transactions are then hashed. Using the hashes, we are able to then combine hashes to create a binary tree where the root is a hash of all transactions taken into account.
en.sc3: This begins by combining the hash of transactions 1 and 2 and hashing the combination to create H(H(1) + H(2))
en.sc4: In the same way, we can combine hashes 3 and 4.
en.sc5: Finally, we can combine H12 and H34 to create one hash that is representative of each transaction. This is the message portion of a block!
